relevant_findings.general: Thin but not malnourished appearing, alert, oriented, no acute distress
relevant_findings.HEENT: Sclera anicteric, MM dry, oropharynx clear
relevant_findings.Neck: Supple, JVP not elevated, no LAD
relevant_findings.Lungs: Clear to auscultation bilaterally, no wheezes, rales, ronchi
relevant_findings.Cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 + S2, no murmurs, rubs, gallops
relevant_findings.Abdomen: Soft, TTP throughout, worse in epigastrium, non-distended, bowel sounds present, no rebound tenderness or guarding, no organomegaly
relevant_findings.Extremities: Warm, well perfused, no clubbing, cyanosis or edema
relevant_findings.Neurological: AAOx3, CNs intact, strength and sensation grossly intact

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Reported progression of abdominal pain from initial visit.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Obvious signs of systemic inflammatory response such as ongoing abdominal pain and symptoms of acute pancreatitis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased pain severity reported over course of hospitalization.
